title: RIOT DATABASE LEAK SECURITY BREACH!!! BE WARNED!!!
body:
https://imgur.com/a/YCI2HIp

So today I was in a game of league and some guy was being well let's just say he was trolling the game. Anyways after some time of trolling I was shocked to see he somehow from no information from me found my email and password. 

The only information he had was my Summoner Name as obviously everyone in game has this information.

From a Summoner name alone he was able to get not only my email but also my password to that email. 

I think it is safe to say RIOT you have an issue and this is not on! It is not acceptable to be harrased in game let alone have someone in game able to find your email adress and password, then give that information to the other 9 people in game. God knows what he could have done with this information and in face since then even though I was quick to change my password in the 10min or so that it took me after the game to change my passwords it was to late. The damage was done and fraudulant payments were made on my credit card.

Roit this is a SERIOUS issue! 

Your player base is at risk this is not acceptable, I now have to go to the police and file a report on the matter. What will riot do about this? My bet is nothing I have already sent support tickets but they probable will give him a few days ban or something stupid like that. Well ROIT this is a serious issue and I really hope you fix what ever data base leak you have!

So Summoners be warned apparenly anyone from your in game name alone can get your email your password and apparently your Credit Card details just by playing a game of league!

replies.body:
If those are your details, then they are not from this LoL account or any other you may have, though if you've had to change your password then that means you use the same password on your LoL account that you use on other services.

This person you encountered is likely quoting info dumped from other services you've used that have been breached. Look up your info on https://haveibeenpwned.com/ and you're likely to be surprised by the amount of services you've used that have had your information stolen or leaked.

This is why you should avoid using the same username and password across different services.
Will this person get a perma ban? This is a huge issue and in my opinion deserves a perma ban. It is some serious harassment!

Ultimately, the player in question has been involved in a serious breach of the ToU, and so Riot will want to take necessary action against them to address the infraction. That said, Riot's standing policy regarding Player Behaviour cases is that they wont provide details of another players punishments to *anyone* (except the punished player), as that classifies as a "breach of privacy", so (unfortunately) all anyone can tell you is that "appropriate action will be taken", just not which *specific* action(s) if any.

Yeah, I gather that would be the case. Though this is quite serious in my opinion. Don't get me wrong I can at times be toxic and stuff, and I have received chat bans deserved. Something like this though I think is quite serious and requires a perma ban on the account. 

Hopefully RIOT will reply to my support ticket and track down the game and take action. Sadly I only have that screenshot that has namea crossed out.

Don't worry, it wont be hard for them to find the game in question, and considering the seriousness of the issue I have no doubt that a perma-ban would be warranted, it's just that Riot can't give confirmation of that because of their policies.

Honestly, I don't know how effective a ban might be to deter or address this kind of behaviour, though. Different people react differently to that kind of thing, and I think it's clear that this particular player isn't being deterred just by the threat of punishment in-game.

Hopefully you're situation will be appropriately addressed by Riot and the police, and you'll be "back to normal" (so to say) soon enough.

Yeah a perma ban won't stop them in my opinion, though at least if they bought any skins or anything they will lose it all. Plus have to level another account or something. It's not much but it's something.

I have asked roit for the chat logs so I can take it to the police, they probably won't do much. Hopefully though the police will follow up the matter with riot and maybe find the person and do something. Probably a long shot but worth a go.

Presumably, the police should chase that up, and perhaps even get a warrant, if you tell them you want to press charges, as is your legal right. It's important to keep in mind, however, that it will be hard to maintain anonymity with the individual who's done this should you choose to pursue such action. I'd recommend you take some time and think about how far you do want to take this, as you do certainly have the option of taking it to court.

You are just going to waste their time, which is, funnily enough, a genuine crime.

While using the Riot Services, you must comply with all laws, rules and regulations in the jurisdiction in which you reside. So now we have got that out of the way and have proven you have no idea what you are talking about, do I even need to continue to shut down every point you just made and show you how wrong every single statment you made is? How about I save you the humiliation?
So with my summoner name that can access all this data? From other sites?

I just want to add on to what Riot Gehirn has said to make sure you're fully protected. 


+ Change your email password

 Like Gehirn said, it's likely that you reused your LoL password on other websites and it was one of those other websites that leaked your info in a data breach. However, I don't know how they linked your email to your LoL account, unless they had access to your email as well.
 
 That's why I strongly advise that you change your email password as well, especially if you have used the same password on other websites. Also, checkout [Edward Snowden's password tips](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yzGzB-yYKcc) to make sure your new password is secure.


+ Don't do chargebacks!

 Going to the police is a good idea (since this person committed theft) but **be careful with chargebacks!** The police or your bank may advise you to chargeback your credit card, but don't do this. **Chargebacks will get your account [temporarily banned](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201753334-Chargebacks)!** Instead you should tell Riot through your support ticket that fraudulent purchases were made on your account, and they will reverse the purchases for you.

Best of luck, and feel free to reply if you need any extra help :)

Thanks, yeah I also don't know how they linked my email with my league account as that is not the email I used for league. To make it even more confusing my summoner name was not associated with that account for any other websites or anything really. Thia is what got me stumped, how did they associate my summoner name to my email that are completely different.

I just wanted to share my experience since my account was recently compromised (March 2nd, 2019).

I started playing LoL in January 2011 and have had the same username since then. I've changed my password exactly once as far as I can remember, when RIOT admitted to having a breach of information sometime in 2012/13. I actually believe RIOT made users do this (I can't recall, since it was so long ago, but I believe that was the case). The two passwords I used were each unique from anything else I've ever used.

I believe I stopped playing sometime in 2014 or so. After a 3 year hiatus, I started playing again in February 2017, I uninstalled the game again that same month. Since that time I've had completely different hardware (I did not sell or give away my old hard disk drives) and I have not had LoL installed any any machine.

I received an e-mail this past weekend saying my account was suspended for a 3rd party program. I went to a stat tracker website and see that someone had gained access to my account, played 8 matches (and was very successful) then was banned the same day. Before that the last match played under my account was me, over two years ago. I'm certain whoever did it was probably accessing accounts to test cheats/hacks for in game exploitation -- I feel like RIOT should be able to find out which IP addresses (if they aren't passed through a VPN/spoofed -- which they probably are) and be able to determine beforehand whether it's a legitimate login. 

I contacted RIOT, mostly because I was angry someone was even able to access and use the account. They determined it was suspicious activity after asking me multiple questions to determine I was the original owner. They rescinded the ban and I actually installed LoL this morning and was able to log in just fine (after I changed my password to something unique for this game again). I plan on enabling two-step verification obviously...but remember, this was not available to users a long time ago when I started playing. I didn't even realize RIOT had 2-step verification until this past week because I haven't really played consistently in like 5 years.

**My personal e-mail was never compromised, I still retained access to my LoL account with my contact e-mail and no resets or information were requested via RIOTs system.** I want to emphasize this because I do see people complaining that a hacker changed their password. This likely means that your e-mail was compromised (or the person uses the same credentials for the game and e-mail). Not the case for me.

I'm glad they did recind it, even though their uncomfortable policy says they don't have to, but this is the concerning part for me:

How in the world did someone get access to my account? I have checked "haveibeenpwned" and ALL passwords I've ever used for the game all came back with being safe/uncompromised. I feel there there is the possibility that my credentials were exposed by either RIOT or there's a possible breach they are unaware of.

I also read of a 2018 data breach, which could be a possible reason. The website 'haveibeenpwned' perhaps may not have that merged data set in the database.

You would think that RIOT should issue mandatory password resets for accounts whenever they catch wind of possible data breaches or employ a location based system that flags when the account is logged in from somewhere atypical (Ubisoft, Steam/Valve, and EA all do this to my knowledge).

I also feel bad for all the people who may have had their accounts hacked within the past year and were unaware of a possible breach. I was not playing the game, but I can tell you I received nothing in the past two years from RIOT about anything until the message my old account was banned.

In a way, it helped them gain a player back, because I'm starting to play LoL again today...wish me luck...a lot has changed since I last played; I barely recognize the game.

May even start playing again myself tbh. It's been in the back of my mind for a while to install the client again

i mean, sure maybe you could get my email address from my league name, but how are they supposed to have my passwords? that makes no sense, riot doesn't even know those.

also if you aren't using a 'limited balance' transfers account for your online purchases, you're certainly taking a risk.

all in all this post doesn't seem to make much sense.

still kinda strange, that even for someone with low security, to simply run into another player who'd bother searching and posting those things.

I mean I have decent security, I change my passwords constantly. Changed them all for every account I could think of just a month or so ago. I also don't use the same passwords for multiple things. The only thing that would be common in most cases is my ingame name. I also have multiple email adresses. One for thinga like paypal banking billa and so on. Others for games and others for random stuff.
